TopicTitle: mk16 parachute ripping off early, could use help.

Articles.Content:
So admittedly I've used realchutes up to this point(not anymore), but before that I didn't, obviously. So I'm deploying my mk16 at around 250 m/s and it is ripping off. Previously I could deploy the stock chute at this speed without that happening. Now I have to get well under 200 m/s to deploy safely, which often times gets me dangerously close to the ground. Is this just how it is? Can anyone help me figure out why this is happening?

I went back to watch the manley tutorials to see if I had unlearned a hundred hours of KSP, but he seems to deploy fine that that speed in 23.5.
use some drogues to slow you down first
Well, first of all, how do you make your re-entry normally? It may be you're comming too fast. Also, at wich altitude do you deploy your parachutes? I say 15.000m is ok.
Heh I was told in another thread that deadly reentry had a bug in it which was fixed in a newer version. Sorry for posting guys, and thank you for your help!
